title: 114_hr3643
content: The "Interim Consolidated Storage Act of 2015" defines an interim consolidated storage facility as a facility licensed to store high-level radioactive waste or spent nuclear fuel from the Secretary or multiple generators. The Nuclear Waste Policy Act of 1982 is amended to include provisions for interim consolidated storage of spent nuclear fuel. The Nuclear Waste Policy Act of 1982 is amended to allow the Secretary to enter contracts for interim consolidated storage of high-level radioactive waste or spent nuclear fuel with licensed facilities. High-level radioactive waste includes Greater than Class C waste, but this does not require disposal in a repository. The Secretary can enter contracts with waste holders for storage at an interim facility, prioritizing waste from sites without operating reactors. Contracts ensure the Secretary's responsibility for waste disposal is fulfilled upon acceptance at the storage facility. The Secretary can enter contracts with waste holders for storage at an interim facility without requiring settlement of claims against the United States for breach of contract. Delivery of waste to the facility transfers title to the Secretary. Amendments allow storage in an interim consolidated facility or monitored retrievable site. The Secretary can enter contracts with waste holders for storage at an interim facility without requiring settlement of claims against the United States for breach of contract. Delivery of waste to the facility transfers title to the Secretary. Amendments allow storage in an interim consolidated storage facility or monitored retrievable storage site. The fees and costs in connection with the storage of high-level radioactive waste or spent nuclear fuel are also addressed. The Nuclear Waste Policy Act of 1982 is amended to allow the Secretary to access necessary funds from the Waste Fund without additional appropriations for costs related to the storage of high-level radioactive waste or spent nuclear fuel in an interim consolidated storage facility. The Nuclear Waste Policy Act of 1982 allows the Secretary to access funds from the Waste Fund for costs related to storage in an interim consolidated storage facility, including fees and costs specified in subsections (d)(4), (d)(5), and (d)(6). The Secretary is limited in spending on dry storage fees to the interest generated by the Waste Fund each fiscal year starting in 2016.
